title: Next taps Stanton Road to help Lynch Group sale bloom
text:
Private equity firm Next Capital has hired an adviser to test buyer appetite in its fresh flowers business Lynch Group.

As Street Talk revealed on Monday, boutique firm Stanton Road Partners has been mandated to oversee a sale process for the company, which makes earnings of about $35 million and is the largest flower exporter in the southern hemisphere.

Next Capital's Lynch Group is the biggest exporter of flowers from Australia to China and specialises in floral innovation, research and development. AFR

It is understood a formal auction will get under way in the new year.

Prospective acquirers are expected to be told that Lynch Group derives revenue from the wholesale of plants and flowers and has distribution centres in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane and Perth. It also operates retailer www.freshflowers.com.au.

It is the only national floral marketer in Australia with ISO and HACCP accreditation, and recorded $232 million in revenue in the 2018 financial year according to IBISWorld.
description: Private equity firm Next Capital has hired an adviser to test buyer appetite in its fresh flowers business Lynch Group.
